00040 /**
00041  * @file

00043  * PKO helper, configuration API
00044  */
00045 
00046 #ifndef __CVMX_HELPER_PKO_H__
00047 #define __CVMX_HELPER_PKO_H__
00048 
00049 /* CSR typedefs have been moved to cvmx-pko-defs.h */
00050 
00051 #if 0   // XXX Not clear what this is intended for !
00052 /**
00053  * Definition of internal state for Packet output processing
00054  */
00055 typedef struct {
00056     uint64_t *start_ptr;        /**< ptr to start of buffer, offset kept in FAU reg */
00057 } cvmx_pko_state_elem_t;
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 /**
00061  * cvmx_override_pko_queue_priority(int ipd_port, uint64_t
00062  * priorities[16]) is a function pointer. It is meant to allow
00063  * customization of the PKO queue priorities based on the port
00064  * number. Users should set this pointer to a function before
00065  * calling any cvmx-helper operations.
00066  */
00067 extern CVMX_SHARED void (*cvmx_override_pko_queue_priority) (int ipd_port, uint8_t * priorities);
00068 
00069 /**
00070  * Gets the fpa pool number of pko pool
00071  */
00072 int64_t cvmx_fpa_get_pko_pool(void);
00073 
00074 /**
00075  * Gets the buffer size of pko pool
00076  */
00077 uint64_t cvmx_fpa_get_pko_pool_block_size(void);
00078 
00079 /**
00080  * Gets the buffer size  of pko pool
00081  */
00082 uint64_t cvmx_fpa_get_pko_pool_buffer_count(void);
00083 
00084 
00085 int cvmx_helper_pko_init(void);

00087 /*
00088  * This function is a no-op
00089  * included here for backwards compatibility only.
00090  */
00091 static inline  int cvmx_pko_initialize_local(void)
00092 {
00093     return 0;
00094 }
